intro: Rondeletia toaensis, commonly known as the Tuaense rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and often have a glossy appearance, contributing to its ornamental value. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories.
